nodes.title:
A seatbelt ticket. A cracked taillight. A broken headlight.

nodes.title:
In Opinion

"A Taiwanese American woman from Chicago is about to become the mayor of Boston, a town that, until Tuesday, had elected only white men to that office," Eileen McNamara writes about Michelle Wu.
https://t.co/gxapgOhFtr

nodes.title: Sunao Tsuboi, a survivor of the atomic bombing in Hiroshima who went on to devote himself to the cause of nuclear disarmament, died on Oct. 24. He was 96. https://t.co/zo5p99tawM
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Almost 97% of active-duty members of the U.S. Air Force have received at least one dose of a coronavirus vaccine, officials said Wednesday. It is the first branch of the U.S. military to reach its deadline for vaccinations. https://t.co/G3llc8g2YL

nodes.title: Phil Murphy was re-elected governor of New Jersey by a slimmer than expected margin, becoming the first Democrat in more than four decades to win a second term in the state. https://t.co/HSiKS7BlBQ https://t.co/o5RT4rGWHl

nodes.title: Vito Perillo, a 97-year-old World War II veteran in New Jersey, won a second term as mayor of the borough of Tinton Falls. He is believed to be the oldest mayor in the U.S. â€” when he leaves office, he will be 101. https://t.co/JJpRmydhXh https://t.co/kwfpEXNcJ4

nodes.title: Shahana Hanif, a former City Council employee, won her election in a Brooklyn district. A Bangladeshi American, she is the first Muslim woman elected to the Council in its history, despite the fact that the city is home to an estimated 769,000 Muslims. https://t.co/EDsJdOKFLS https://t.co/PobHgFKvpe

nodes.title: Michelle Wu, who entered public service out of frustration with the obstacles that her immigrant family faced, will be the next mayor of Boston. The city has been led by an unbroken string of Irish American or Italian American men since the 1930s. https://t.co/MVL3bE0F0C https://t.co/thku9JE8Wp

nodes.title: Alvin Bragg was elected Manhattan district attorney on Tuesday. The influential office handles tens of thousands of cases a year and is conducting a high-profile investigation into Donald Trump and his family business. https://t.co/01r7gsE7ut https://t.co/YgqrjMbwRj
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: The prosecution in Kyle Rittenhouse's trial has repeatedly returned to the fact he was "the only person who killed anyone" during several days of unrest in Kenosha, asking the jury to "keep that in mind" when considering the reasonableness of his actions. https://t.co/ICb1zyCvxo
